q:
An airline information system is created using .NET Framework v4.6. The following code is a part of the flights.xml file:

<Flights>
  <Flight ID=""1"" Name=""Flight1"" Year=""2006"">
    <Desc Value=""Flight desc""/>
  </Flight>
  <Flight ID=""2"" Name=""Flight2"" Year=""2007"">
    <Desc Value=""Flight desc""/>
  </Flight>
  <Flight ID=""3"" Name=""Flight3"" Year=""2008"">
    <Desc Value=""Flight desc""/>
  </Flight>
</ Flights >

The following web form is added to the application:

1 <form runat="server">
2 <asp:xmldatasource
3 id="XmlDataSource1"
4 runat="server"
5 datafile="flights.xml" />
6 ....... //Add missing code 1
...... //Add missing code 2
7 </form>

Complete the web form from the following options to implement the XmlDataSource control to display the XML data in a TreeView control.

Options:

  1. <asp:TreeView ID="TreeView1" runat="server" DataSourceID="FlightDataSource1"><DataBindings> <asp:TreeNodeBinding DataMember="Flight" Text="Name" /></DataBindings></asp:TreeView>
  2.  <asp:TreeView ID="TreeView1" runat="server" DataSourceID=" FlightDataSource1"><DataBindings> <asp:TreeNodeBinding DataMember=" Flights" Text="Desc" /></DataBindings></asp:TreeView>
  3. <asp:TreeView ID="TreeView1" runat="server" DataSourceID="XmlDataSource1"><DataBindings> <asp:TreeNodeBinding DataMember=" Flight" Text="Name" /></DataBindings></asp:TreeView>
  4. <asp:TreeView ID="TreeView1" runat="server" DataSourceID="XmlDataSource1"><DataBindings> <asp:TreeNodeBinding DataMember=" Flights" Text="Desc" /></DataBindings></asp:TreeView>
